column4: i've just installed an apache server in my home machine (ubuntu), and it seems to work... how do i make it accesible from the outside, now?
Too many variables.  But simple WAG would be port fwd port 80 to the internal machine assuming you are behind a NAT device.
are you attemping to get to it from your PC?
should i try from a web proxy ?
you can try from outside and see.
from inside the router might be confused with the hair pinning.
you would need to if  you are blocking it currently :)
i just did... is my computer like totally insecure right now?
well if you run a webserver connected to the public internet there is some level of insecurity. need to make sure all the scripts etc are secure..
hitting your ip with a browser bring up php proxy, is that what you where looking to do?
i guess you already tried my ip  :)
cool it works... i couldn't try it myself, but a friend helped
now, can i protect my homepage with a password ?
if running apache, just google for htaccess and you should be all set. for the password stuff
